Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.store.record

Enum RecordLoad

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<RecordLoad>
      • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.store.record.RecordLoad
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<RecordLoad>
    public enum RecordLoad
extends Enum<RecordLoad>
    Specifies what happens when loading records, based on inUse status. Roughly this is what happens for the different modes:
    • CHECK: Load at least data to determine whether it's in use or not. If in use then record is loaded into target and returns true, otherwise return false.
    • NORMAL: Load at least data to determine whether it's in use or not. if in use then record is loaded into target returns true, otherwise throws InvalidRecordException.
    • FORCE: Loads record data into target regardless of whether record in use or not. Returns whether record is in use or not.
    • ALWAYS: always load all record data, even if the record is marked as not in use, but unlike FORCE it will throw decoding and out-of-bounds exceptions. Will not throw InvalidRecordExceptions for records that are not in use.
    There are also "LENIENT" variants of all those (except #FORCE), with the difference that reading a record which is not the first unit in a multi-unit record won't raise a cursor exception.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      ALWAYS  
      CHECK  
      FORCE  
      LENIENT_ALWAYS  
      LENIENT_CHECK  
      LENIENT_NORMAL  
      NORMAL  

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean alwaysLoad
      true: read record data even if the record is marked as unused false: do not read record data for unused record
      private boolean failOnCursorException
      true: check and throw cursor exception from most recent record read/write false: do not check or throw cursor exception from most recent record read/write
      private boolean failOnNonFirstUnit
      A lenient cursor, e.g. a scan needs a special flag since it may try to read records that aren't the first unit in multi-unit records, with the expectation that the record should simply look like unused instead of throwing exception true: reading a non-first record unit for a multi-unit record will simply complete successfully with the record left in a state where it looks unused false: reading a non-first record unit for a multi-unit record will set cursor exception
      private boolean failOnUnused
      true: reading unused record will throw InvalidRecordException false: reading unused record will simply not load the record
      private RecordLoad lenientVariant
      Accessor for the lenient variant of this RecordLoad, i.e. the variant with the same parameters, except that failOnNonFirstUnit() returns false.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      private RecordLoad​(boolean alwaysLoad, boolean failOnUnused, boolean failOnCursorException)
      Constructor for lenient variants which will have failOnNonFirstUnit set to false and its lenientVariant set to null, which means it's already a lenient variant and will return itself in lenient()
      private RecordLoad​(boolean alwaysLoad, boolean failOnUnused, boolean failOnCursorException, boolean failOnNonFirstUnit, RecordLoad lenientVariant)  
      private RecordLoad​(RecordLoad lenientVariant)
      Constructor for strict variants, i.e. has the parameters of the lenientVariant, except for failOnNonFirstUnit which is true.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean checkForOutOfBounds​(PageCursor cursor)
      Checks the given PageCursor to see if its out-of-bounds flag has been raised, and returns true if that is the case and and out-of-bounds condition should be reported up the stack.
      void clearOrThrowCursorError​(PageCursor cursor)
      Depending on the mode, this will - if a cursor error has been raised on the given PageCursor - either throw an InvalidRecordException with the underlying CursorException, or clear the error condition on the cursor.
      boolean failOnNonFirstUnit()  
      RecordLoad lenient()  
      boolean shouldLoad​(boolean inUse)
      Checks whether a record should be fully loaded from PageCursor, based on inUse status.

      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static RecordLoad[] values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      boolean verify​(AbstractBaseRecord record)
      Verifies that a record's in use status is in line with the mode, might throw InvalidRecordException.

    • Field Detail

      • alwaysLoad

        private final boolean alwaysLoad
        • true: read record data even if the record is marked as unused
        • false: do not read record data for unused record

      • failOnUnused

        private final boolean failOnUnused
        • true: reading unused record will throw InvalidRecordException
        • false: reading unused record will simply not load the record

      • failOnCursorException

        private final boolean failOnCursorException
        • true: check and throw cursor exception from most recent record read/write
        • false: do not check or throw cursor exception from most recent record read/write

      • failOnNonFirstUnit

        private final boolean failOnNonFirstUnit
        A lenient cursor, e.g. a scan needs a special flag since it may try to read records that aren't the first unit in multi-unit records, with the expectation that the record should simply look like unused instead of throwing exception
        • true: reading a non-first record unit for a multi-unit record will simply complete successfully with the record left in a state where it looks unused
        • false: reading a non-first record unit for a multi-unit record will set cursor exception

      • lenientVariant

        private final RecordLoad lenientVariant
        Accessor for the lenient variant of this RecordLoad, i.e. the variant with the same parameters, except that failOnNonFirstUnit() returns false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecordLoad

        private RecordLoad​(boolean alwaysLoad,
                   boolean failOnUnused,
                   boolean failOnCursorException)
        Constructor for lenient variants which will have failOnNonFirstUnit set to false and its lenientVariant set to null, which means it's already a lenient variant and will return itself in lenient()

      • RecordLoad

        private RecordLoad​(RecordLoad lenientVariant)
        Constructor for strict variants, i.e. has the parameters of the lenientVariant, except for failOnNonFirstUnit which is true.

      • RecordLoad

        private RecordLoad​(boolean alwaysLoad,
                   boolean failOnUnused,
                   boolean failOnCursorException,
                   boolean failOnNonFirstUnit,
                   RecordLoad lenientVariant)

      • shouldLoad

        public final boolean shouldLoad​(boolean inUse)
        Checks whether a record should be fully loaded from PageCursor, based on inUse status.

      • verify

        public final boolean verify​(AbstractBaseRecord record)
        Verifies that a record's in use status is in line with the mode, might throw InvalidRecordException.

      • clearOrThrowCursorError

        public final void clearOrThrowCursorError​(PageCursor cursor)
        Depending on the mode, this will - if a cursor error has been raised on the given PageCursor - either throw an InvalidRecordException with the underlying CursorException, or clear the error condition on the cursor.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The PageCursor to be checked for errors.

      • checkForOutOfBounds

        public boolean checkForOutOfBounds​(PageCursor cursor)
        Checks the given PageCursor to see if its out-of-bounds flag has been raised, and returns true if that is the case and and out-of-bounds condition should be reported up the stack.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The PageCursor to check the bounds flag for.
        Returns:
        true if an out-of-bounds condition should be reported up the stack, false otherwise.
